CN.content:

Paragraph: The best PCE was also achieved when o-dichlorobenzene was used as a solvent and the optimum thickness for the active layer was ca.

Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The best PCE was also achieved when o-dichlorobenzene was used as a solvent and the optimum thickness for the active layer was ca.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE: Phrase "the best PCE" refers to the Power Conversion Efficiency, which is a property value related to the performance of a solar cell or other energy conversion device.
2. o-dichlorobenzene: This is a specific type of solvent mentioned in the paragraph. While not explicitly stated as a property value, it can be considered an input or condition that led to the achievement of the best PCE.
3. ca. (approximately): This is a quantifier, not a property value itself, but it is used to modify the property value "optimum thickness" in the following phrase.
4. optimum thickness: This is a property value related to the active layer in the context of the paragraph. It refers to the thickness that results in the best PCE when using o-dichlorobenzene as a solvent.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency, a material property related to the performance of a solar cell or other energy conversion device.
2. optimum thickness: A material property value related to the active layer, indicating the thickness that results in the best PCE when using o-dichlorobenzene as a solvent.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |
| optimum thickness (for the active layer) |
